commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.0 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering

Update Sphinx version as well.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Set openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' as name.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/728938
Change-Id: I4f21de08de3bfd89bf8e331b6c819932cde8ca2f

subject: Resolve UnboundLocalError
messages:
[{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-05-01 15:47:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-05-12 11:47:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

LGTM Tested locally these changes seems to fix the issue.

With these changes I get a `ConfigFileValueError` all the time (c.f details how to reproduce in the LP).

Without these changes I can reproduce the original issue related to the `alt_loc` var.

Scenario that I followed to test these changes:
```
$ git review -d 724880
$ cat <<EOF>/tmp/test.py 
from __future__ import print_function

from oslo_config import cfg
from os import environ

g = cfg.OptGroup("group")
foo = cfg.StrOpt("foo", regex="^[a-z].*$")

cfg.CONF.register_opt(foo, group=g)

environ["OS_GROUP__FOO"] = "abc"
cfg.CONF()
print("### Correct value set via env variable")
print(cfg.CONF.group.foo)

environ["OS_GROUP__FOO"] = "ABC"
cfg.CONF()
print("### Invalid value set via env variable")
print(cfg.CONF.group.foo)

del environ["OS_GROUP__FOO"]
cfg.CONF()
print("### Invalid value from conf file")
print(cfg.CONF.group.foo)
EOF
$ cat <<EOF>/tmp/config.cfg 
[group]
foo=BAR
EOF
$ tox -e venv -- python /tmp/test.py --config-file /tmp/config.cfg
$ # I get ConfigFileValueError
$ echo "" > /tmp/config.cfg
$ tox -e venv -- python /tmp/test.py --config-file /tmp/config.cfg
$ # I get ConfigFileValueError
$ git checkout master
$ tox -e venv -- python /tmp/test.py --config-file /tmp/config.cfg
$ # I get UnboundLocalError on alt_loc
```'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-05-12 12:50:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-05-19 10:29:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-01 15:47:27.000000000', 'message': "Resolve UnboundLocalError

As discussed in bug 1841038, configuring a StrOpt with a regex parameter
and providing an invalid environment variable will result in an ugly
stacktrace due to an undefined 'alt_loc' variable. Resolve this by
creating said variable.

Change-Id: Id0fb6efdc435a2bd88d5dfea2b4720df453fbfec
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1841038
"}]
commit_message:
Resolve UnboundLocalError

As discussed in bug 1841038, configuring a StrOpt with a regex parameter
and providing an invalid environment variable will result in an ugly
stacktrace due to an undefined 'alt_loc' variable. Resolve this by
creating said variable.

Change-Id: Id0fb6efdc435a2bd88d5dfea2b4720df453fbfec
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1841038

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-14 09:35:55.000000000', 'message': '[OVN]: Make _delete_port() more error-resilent

This patch is making the transaction from the _delete_port() method in
OVNClient more resilient to errors where elements from that transaction
have already been deleted by another change in the database.

Prior to this patch, a few places could potentially raise RowNotFound
which would abort the whole transaction and would leave the a stable
port for being cleaned up after by the maintenance thread. This patch
tries to catch those exceptions that could potentially fail the
transaction.

Change-Id: I8fd1d1485269d23529a19085bd4aa4c6c74f5f91
Partial-Bug: #1874733
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from Neutron commit 8b234d8786072c9bc83d19e0cde3927fc5ccf8f8)

Prior to this patch, a few places could potentially raise RowNotFound

commit_message:
[OVN]: Make _delete_port() more error-resilent

This patch is making the transaction from the _delete_port() method in
OVNClient more resilient to errors where elements from that transaction
have already been deleted by another change in the database.

Prior to this patch, a few places could potentially raise RowNotFound
which would abort the whole transaction and would leave the a stable
port for being cleaned up after by the maintenance thread. This patch
tries to catch those exceptions that could potentially fail the
transaction.

Change-Id: I8fd1d1485269d23529a19085bd4aa4c6c74f5f91
Partial-Bug: #1874733
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from Neutron commit 8b234d8786072c9bc83d19e0cde3927fc5ccf8f8)

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.0. Using this versions
will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Remove reno, it's not used in this repo.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Set openstackdocs_auto_version to not auto-version the documents.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/728938
Change-Id: If1e4ca76901ec5528969f4d7c706fc840f02562b

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.0 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Change-Id: I3f3d44ec367e40c14d5ec589a22df395346970b4

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-18 06:21:04.000000000', 'message': 'CI: Discern between Ironic client and grep failure

Pipe hid an issue that Ironic client was not available in CI,
making it look as if fake-hardware driver was not usable.

This commit applies separation of concerns to easily discern
between the two failures and provide better debugging experience.

Change-Id: Iac3d84b7d707b84a8426c8d787b29a368ff7ae85
Related-Bug: #1872481
(cherry picked from commit 1243337a1ccfe59031aa635ff7dbe9a4afda39c4)
'}]
commit_message:
CI: Discern between Ironic client and grep failure

Pipe hid an issue that Ironic client was not available in CI,
making it look as if fake-hardware driver was not usable.

This commit applies separation of concerns to easily discern
between the two failures and provide better debugging experience.

Change-Id: Iac3d84b7d707b84a8426c8d787b29a368ff7ae85
Related-Bug: #1872481
(cherry picked from commit 1243337a1ccfe59031aa635ff7dbe9a4afda39c4)

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.0 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames. A
couple of variables are also not needed anymore, remove them.

Set openstackdocs_auto_name to use project as name.

Fix wrong indent in index.rst that lead to a grey bar on the left of the
toc.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/728938
Change-Id: If82be6fbfb12cedd8f9dcfb4468415e085d1c821

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.0 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames. A
couple of variables are also not needed anymore, remove them.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/728938
Change-Id: If23ebf2dcf6304d5ea50c5e427bfad217ce0d235

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.0 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/728938
Change-Id: I6b95add07b469274ba1bf0070ba8c18b1795be41

commit_message:
Remove deprecated exception classes

These classes were deprecated in Stein and marked for removal in Ussuri.
By removing these classes, we fix pep8 issues (catching-non-exception)
we started seeing at the gate with the release of astroid 2.4.0.

(cherry picked from commit 0056b5175f89070164849501ec6d960549b95e34)

Fix E741 pep8 errors

E741 ambiguous variable name 'l'

Change 'l' to another variable in affected code.

Change-Id: Idd176e40ccf2a79832a5c99140bd30e5e1f9c0d8
(cherry picked from commit 9a1d6d3585070da570bcf6313e237b486bdac81b)

subject: Configure RabbitMQ user tags in nova-cell role
messages: [{'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2020-04-29 13:42:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2020-04-29 13:46:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1\n\nfix master first.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-05-18 08:46:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-05-18 08:46:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 27336, 'date': '2020-05-19 00:47:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-05-19 09:03:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-29 13:42:57.000000000', 'message': 'Configure rabbitmq user tags in nova-cell role

the user administrator tags configure in rabbitmq definitions.json file
is removed in nova-cell role. This patch fix add the tag back.

Change-Id: I7a5d6fe324dd133e0929804d431583e5b5c1853d
Closes-Bug: #1875786
'}, {'created': '2020-05-18 08:46:01.000000000', 'message': "Configure RabbitMQ user tags in nova-cell role

The RabbitMQ 'openstack' user has the 'administrator' tag assigned via
the RabbitMQ definitions.json file.

Since the Train release, the nova-cell role also configures the RabbitMQ
user, but omits the tag. This causes the tag to be removed from the
user, which prevents it from accessing the management UI and API.

This change adds support for configuring user tags to the
service-rabbitmq role, and sets the administrator tag by default.

Change-Id: I7a5d6fe324dd133e0929804d431583e5b5c1853d
Closes-Bug: #1875786
(cherry picked from commit 869e3f21c2e929c8d6731a09e0283ced92cdbf6a)
"}]
commit_message:
Configure RabbitMQ user tags in nova-cell role

The RabbitMQ 'openstack' user has the 'administrator' tag assigned via
the RabbitMQ definitions.json file.

Since the Train release, the nova-cell role also configures the RabbitMQ
user, but omits the tag. This causes the tag to be removed from the
user, which prevents it from accessing the management UI and API.

This change adds support for configuring user tags to the
service-rabbitmq role, and sets the administrator tag by default.

Change-Id: I7a5d6fe324dd133e0929804d431583e5b5c1853d
Closes-Bug: #1875786
(cherry picked from commit 869e3f21c2e929c8d6731a09e0283ced92cdbf6a)

these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* parallelizing building of documents

Update Sphinx version as well.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Set openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' as name.

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.0 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* parallelizing building of documents

Update Sphinx version as well.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file.
Set openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' as name.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/728938
Change-Id: I76a21521eeb432c3f4089048a4635719ba6d785c

commit_message:
Expose grafana, dashboard and mgr port parameters

ceph-ansible computes facts to run ceph services on the proper
ip addresses, using default ports.
Due to "how ansible gather the instance facts" this can result
in an issue when haproxy services are included in the overcloud
deployment, because in a standalone environment, frontend and
backend ip addresses can be the same.
The purpose of this patch is to expose the port parameter of the
involved ceph services, making them configurable.
By doing this, we should be able to properly customize haproxy
with the default config provided by puppet manifests, customizing
the backend server address/ports in the job definitions.

Change-Id: I5b3b4b96a60c75826a24019932b368a9d2413385

commit_message:
Document and test maximum supported version of Ansible

The Stein release supports up to Ansible 2.9. This patch states this in
the documentation, and updates our testing to match.

Change-Id: I83d068a242d2e64b5e971be1549935f87641cf8e
Closes-Bug: #1878328
(cherry picked from commit 7b22f394f3392dc63f16cb6a195309f7b0ddf929)

commit_message:
Enable focal and ussuri as part of the gate tests

The func-test-pr is to add retries to the instance pinging as it's
too optimistic to expect it on the first one every time.

func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/279
Change-Id: I92f7b921718cd30290856b878f7d3e77fe4d6425

commit_message:
Match hostname when doing node delete

``overcloud node delete`` at present matches the provided nova
instance ids with existing severs to build the heat blacklist.
This patch would allow users to also use hostnames when deleting
nodes. This will work with deployed servers and scale_playbook.yaml
that matches host pattern.

Partial-Bug: #1869089
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/727696
Change-Id: I3066689facc169125ade29156190cb98910f32b8
(cherry picked from commit be7c90e30c8a64969894fee8e424f665f1a5a00c)
(cherry picked from commit 56c0fd5cafc75b1a5197897551c2224e14acdcad)

Use stable/train branches for DevStack plugin

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-18 19:21:15.000000000', 'message': "[train-only] Remove pycodestyle from test requirements

stable/train's pep8 job started to fail with some error as pycodestyle
2.6.0 version was released.

Based on patch I0bb9077f1cea2243b7945e87cfa140f9cf89d558:
no need to have pycodestyle in test-requirements.txt as it is only a
dependency of flake8 which handles its version requirements correctly.

This fix is not needed on master due to the above mentioned patch
removed it from there. Neither needed in Stein, because pycodestyle is
not added in test-requirements.txt yet in Stein.

Change-Id: Id564eea41e293872dc299f50e159c66d0d3e661e
"}, {'created': '2020-05-18 20:06:02.000000000', 'message': "[train-only] Cap pycodestyle to < 2.6.0

stable/train's pep8 job started to fail with some error as pycodestyle
2.6.0 version was released. To fix this add pycodestyle<2.6.0
constraint to test-requirements.txt

This fix is not needed on master due to pycodestyle is not listed in
test-requirements anymore. Neither needed in Stein, because pycodestyle
requirement is not added there yet.

Change-Id: Id564eea41e293872dc299f50e159c66d0d3e661e
"}]
commit_message:
[train-only] Cap pycodestyle to < 2.6.0

stable/train's pep8 job started to fail with some error as pycodestyle
2.6.0 version was released. To fix this add pycodestyle<2.6.0
constraint to test-requirements.txt

This fix is not needed on master due to pycodestyle is not listed in
test-requirements anymore. Neither needed in Stein, because pycodestyle
requirement is not added there yet.

Change-Id: Id564eea41e293872dc299f50e159c66d0d3e661e

subject: scanner: Scan all branches by default
messages:
[{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-04-21 13:49:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-04-21 14:07:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-04-22 15:11:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

Took me a while to figure out why this wasn't working. This makes the Sphinx extension scan all branches, which we probably don't want. The specific issue we're seeing is that the 'examples/notes/add-complex-example-6b5927c246456896.yaml' example existed on master before 'stable/newton' was created and then was modified after that branched off. I should disable scanning of all branches for Sphinx (or at least make it opt-in), but we should also handle this mismatch between branches since I'd imagine that'll be an issue elsewhere."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-04-22 15:13:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/792548/'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-05-19 10:29:08.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-21 13:49:19.000000000', 'message': 'scanner: Scan all branches by default

There are only two callers to 'get_notes_by_branch', the scanner and the
loader. Since Ibe92a9fa5f42b5a7160201cd64ee6a93f9a78229, the former has
scanned all branches in order to ensure a complete history is built up.
However, not only should the latter really should have been doing the
same, but every test we have calls 'get_notes_by_branch' once, using the
default branch, limiting our test coverage.

Resolve this by moving the "scan all branches" functionality into
'get_notes_by_branch' itself. This means both the loader and the test
are resolved.

Change-Id: I58a57b1e129605a32a66e5dc707340b5af55a1b3
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-04-21 14:07:35.000000000', 'message': 'scanner: Scan all branches by default

There are only two callers to 'get_notes_by_branch', the scanner and the
loader. Since Ibe92a9fa5f42b5a7160201cd64ee6a93f9a78229, the former has
scanned all branches in order to ensure a complete history is built up.
However, not only should the latter really should have been doing the
same, but every test we have calls 'get_notes_by_branch' once, using the
default branch, limiting our test coverage.

Resolve this by moving the "scan all branches" functionality into
'get_notes_by_branch' itself. This means both the loader and the test
are resolved.

Change-Id: I58a57b1e129605a32a66e5dc707340b5af55a1b3
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
scanner: Scan all branches by default

There are only two callers to 'get_notes_by_branch', the scanner and the
loader. Since Ibe92a9fa5f42b5a7160201cd64ee6a93f9a78229, the former has
scanned all branches in order to ensure a complete history is built up.
However, not only should the latter really should have been doing the
same, but every test we have calls 'get_notes_by_branch' once, using the
default branch, limiting our test coverage.

Resolve this by moving the "scan all branches" functionality into
'get_notes_by_branch' itself. This means both the loader and the test
are resolved.

Change-Id: I58a57b1e129605a32a66e5dc707340b5af55a1b3
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

does not return location information from the API, nova will fail to

This commit makes flatten call idempotent, so that it ignores already

commit_message:
Make RBD imagebackend flatten method idempotent

If glance and nova are both configured with RBD backend, but glance
does not return location information from the API, nova will fail to
clone the image from glance pool and will download it from the API.
In this case, image will be already flat, and subsequent flatten call
will fail.

This commit makes flatten call idempotent, so that it ignores already
flat images by catching ImageUnacceptable when requesting parent info
from ceph.

Closes-Bug: 1860990
Change-Id: Ia6c184c31a980e4728b7309b2afaec4d9f494ac3
(cherry picked from commit 65825ebfbd58920adac5e8594891eec8e9cec41f)
(cherry picked from commit 03d59e289369df4980bc1e7350e7f52a6f6aa828)
(cherry picked from commit dd3c17216cdf2814cbefc83371c712b3dd9d9147)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-18 19:51:06.000000000', 'message': 'Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.0 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/728938
Change-Id: I0f59a6eb8318b9ae65c57dba1012bbded5e7186b
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.0 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/728938
Change-Id: I0f59a6eb8318b9ae65c57dba1012bbded5e7186b

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-18 20:27:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix auto_name logic

In this case:
project = "Some random name"
openstackdocs_auto_name = False
openstackdocs_auto_version = True

The call packaging.get_version(project_name) would fail, like in
python-monascaclient change https://review.opendev.org/729023.

Fix the logic to use the real project name for getting the version.

Change-Id: I0cb51a6535936bdc009a34a5956434030dd6bec8
'}]
commit_message:
Fix auto_name logic

In this case:
project = "Some random name"
openstackdocs_auto_name = False
openstackdocs_auto_version = True

The call packaging.get_version(project_name) would fail, like in
python-monascaclient change https://review.opendev.org/729023.

Fix the logic to use the real project name for getting the version.

Change-Id: I0cb51a6535936bdc009a34a5956434030dd6bec8

commit_message:
Change ownership of tce info dir

The tce-load command saves info of installed packages under
/usr/local/tce.installed that is created during the build process
by the root user.
That will cause access and writing issues when running tce-load
as normal user, and we shouldn't run tce-load as root.

Change-Id: I2c369bc0280b3b73339fb49c2d257555d9d2d937

commit_message:
Fix UEFI boot support

UEFI booting support was removed on Debian/Ubuntu was broken by the
removal of ovmf and qemu-efi package installs during a package list
cleanup[1].

It looks like suse/redhat did not reecive the same cleanup effects,
as the UEFI bootloader packages are still installed there, so no
fix is needed on those OS families.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/662585/

Change-Id: I8ce72e4a0c754a745b1abf42030e41d6084f1361
(cherry picked from commit ea84b14612061025d6c6a7c63a84a81ebc721d7d)

commit_message:
Allow rbd mirror client to query mgr

Querying mirror pool status now requires read perms on mgr. Without
this perm a warning is thrown which corrupts the json output.

Closes-Bug: #1851869
Change-Id: I59266da1bf393468f8e0c69dd7212e4cc6de96cf

commit_message:
Bump hacking min version to 3.0.1

hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to avoid bringing in a new
version with new checks.

bumping the min version for hacking so that any older hacking versions
which auto adopt the new checks are not used.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/728335/

Conflicts:
      test-requirements.txt due to I1068850072e639ee268d68ca82249f569a40310e

Change-Id: Ie00c10332bd7110169dbb150d601c157b6694d05
(cherry picked from commit 9f2e24a5a4787cd63d3651af7eec6bcf16b9fcce)
(cherry picked from commit e7ea1226b190dee2bb282f629005600fb5f5dcb1)

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.0 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Set openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' as name.

Use releasenotes jobs template instead of individual jobs.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/728938
Change-Id: I2f3f66a19cda62c6d51c764a0d7e2a163d8abe74

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.0 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Set openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' as name.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/728938
Change-Id: Ic9b4859ad14431c2ab6cc67e053757c0e728d40e

commit_message:
Fix case sensitive path comparisons

Windows paths are case insensitive. Furthermore, Hyper-V even
flips the casing in some cases.

For that reason, we have to ensure that our path comparisons
are case insensitive.

Change-Id: I4cb059c6bdcb09f7e0c3217fe34654c8e197b67d
Closes-Bug: #1878579
(cherry picked from commit d96fed4f3c5205b562865eefd4cffe1c1b151d4b)

[{'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2020-05-06 13:37:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2020-05-07 12:05:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 5241, 'date': '2020-05-07 12:51:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-05-07 17:07:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6924, 'date': '2020-05-15 10:55:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-05-15 12:54:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

What is the ceph-on-ceph topic about? Is there a larger project to run Ceph on ceph (why?). Does it involve OpenStack with OpenShift with OCS? Looking for a little more context.'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2020-05-15 13:26:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Is [1] enough to test this is working properly?
should we define in scenario001 other relevant stf related variables [2]?

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/ci/environments/scenario001-standalone.yaml#L14
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/198c1f890dec38c31126d607a64059f3da9adc87/environments/enable-stf.yaml'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-05-15 13:43:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I can see it working because 001 has the ceph collectd logs starting [1] while the same job without this patch does not [2].

[1] https://0a89c7fd197f008c5875-18acae3550a14afbd46e45014db8ab53.ssl.cf5.rackcdn.com/725854/2/check/tripleo-ci-centos-8-scenario001-standalone/e6988e3/logs/undercloud/var/log/containers/collectd/collectd.log

[2] https://d16132ed1c9b59b90a27-1b181ccf4b7a8e0ab1baa52156407982.ssl.cf5.rackcdn.com/726875/1/check/tripleo-ci-centos-8-scenario001-standalone/bd88503/logs/undercloud/var/log/containers/collectd/collectd.log'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-05-15 13:45:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

How is this change supposed to co-exist with the ceph dashboard? 

If I enabled dashboard do I still want to run the ceph collectd? 

Do we want to document that users should pick one or the other?'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-05-15 13:48:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

This looks like a valid technical implementation so I don't think there's any problem in "how" this is being done. I just wanted to understand the "what" and "why" for the collectd telemetry and the ceph dashboard telemetry. Is there a blueprint explaining the goal? It can be super brief or even an explanation in this review. I'm just coming into this without enough context.'}, {'account_id': 6924, 'date': '2020-05-15 13:58:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

dropping +2 until ceph questions are answered.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-05-15 14:30:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I understand this is fixing a bug. Please add a closes-bug to the commit message.

Let's ensure the serviced deployed by ceph-dashboard and this patch can co-exist."}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2020-05-15 14:30:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > What is the ceph-on-ceph topic about? Is there a larger project to
 > run Ceph on ceph (why?). Does it involve OpenStack with OpenShift
 > with OCS? Looking for a little more context.

currently, there is no ability to configure the collectd-ceph plugin only deployed on ceph nodes. On the other side, collectd did not handle (globally configured osd.asoks) well, if they are not existing on a specific node (e.g on a controller node).

This is to only deploy the plugin on nodes where ceph is deployed.'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2020-05-15 14:40:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

On the collectd side, there was a fix for the bug of not working properly when a asok is not accessible. That is this one: https://github.com/collectd/collectd/commit/ebb55faa02862943194ece904236a10200125c95

On the other side, it's just ugly to deploy the plugin everywhere and only really use it on the nodes where ceph is deployed."}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2020-05-15 14:42:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7294, 'date': '2020-05-15 14:46:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > What is the ceph-on-ceph topic about? Is there a larger project to
 > run Ceph on ceph (why?). Does it involve OpenStack with OpenShift
 > with OCS? Looking for a little more context.

I think it's just a typo. I assume it's meant to be collectd-on-ceph"}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-05-15 14:46:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

We see dashboard running (001 deploys it) [1][2] and we see collectd started for ceph [3]. Co-existence of the two does not seem broken. 

Overall, I understand now that we want to allow both to run.

[1] https://0a89c7fd197f008c5875-18acae3550a14afbd46e45014db8ab53.ssl.cf5.rackcdn.com/725854/2/check/tripleo-ci-centos-8-scenario001-standalone/e6988e3/logs/undercloud/var/log/extra/netstat.txt

[2] https://0a89c7fd197f008c5875-18acae3550a14afbd46e45014db8ab53.ssl.cf5.rackcdn.com/725854/2/check/tripleo-ci-centos-8-scenario001-standalone/e6988e3/logs/undercloud/var/log/extra/podman/containers/grafana-server/stdout.log

[3]  https://0a89c7fd197f008c5875-18acae3550a14afbd46e45014db8ab53.ssl.cf5.rackcdn.com/725854/2/check/tripleo-ci-centos-8-scenario001-standalone/e6988e3/logs/undercloud/var/log/containers/collectd/collectd.log'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-05-15 14:47:05.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from ceph-on-ceph to collectd-on-ceph'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-05-15 14:47:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > (1 comment)
 > >
 > > What is the ceph-on-ceph topic about? Is there a larger project
 > to
 > > run Ceph on ceph (why?). Does it involve OpenStack with OpenShift
 > > with OCS? Looking for a little more context.
 > 
 > I think it's just a typo. I assume it's meant to be
 > collectd-on-ceph

ok, good."}, {'account_id': 7294, 'date': '2020-05-15 14:47:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> How is this change supposed to co-exist with the ceph dashboard?
 > 
 > If I enabled dashboard do I still want to run the ceph collectd?
 > 
 > Do we want to document that users should pick one or the other?

I don't understand how this would interfere with the ceph dashboard. The idea here is to be able to collect information about a ceph deployment and place that data on AMQP for live access via STF.

I believe this is intended to just be read-only (measurement) data, so there should be no interference no?"}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-05-15 14:48:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2020-05-15 14:55:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2020-05-19 07:30:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/train as commit cb1962f0a9de7cbb990ccc1f650708a431b24b46'}]

commit_message:
Enable collectd-ceph plugin only where needed

We need to ensure that ceph plugin is enabled only on relevant nodes,
otherwise it might bring whole collectd down (unlike other collectd plugins)

Change-Id: I36735dc6699e957ee8903ee5a8e9f642740ea5d3

commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: Ifa4d40fdfb026dd93e990a226d3c77e1ad292af5
(cherry picked from commit d316d57ab70b9272cbfc70af7b3daa99e988a8c1)

commit_message:
Fix case sensitive path comparisons

Windows paths are case insensitive. Furthermore, Hyper-V even
flips the casing in some cases.

For that reason, we have to ensure that our path comparisons
are case insensitive.

Change-Id: I4cb059c6bdcb09f7e0c3217fe34654c8e197b67d
Closes-Bug: #1878579
(cherry picked from commit d96fed4f3c5205b562865eefd4cffe1c1b151d4b)

commit_message:
If VIP is set, wait until ha.available

The charm was sending an individual unit's address even when the VIP
configuration value was set. If VIP is set and we have not yet reached
the ha.available state, wait on publishing the vault url.

Change-Id: I3de05b5e771dc4b7c43996d99ccc4b5d8668737d
Closes-Bug: #1878035

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-05-19 06:05:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2020-05-19 06:25:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-19 06:05:43.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.0 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Set openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' as name.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Change-Id: I8de23470cda92374f7b6df89548bbbe23570805f
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.0 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Set openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' as name.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Change-Id: I8de23470cda92374f7b6df89548bbbe23570805f

commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: Ief6bc5af5ee7f12053d15a8fb72c0f3e14b671e1
(cherry picked from commit 775ff74899772a3da33620d977f2eeb8e2f8c3c2)

[{'created': '2020-05-14 09:52:33.000000000', 'message': 'Fix case sensitive path comparisons

Windows paths are case insensitive. Furthermore, Hyper-V even
flips the casing in some cases.

For that reason, we have to ensure that our path comparisons
are case insensitive.

commit_message:
Fix case sensitive path comparisons

Windows paths are case insensitive. Furthermore, Hyper-V even
flips the casing in some cases.

For that reason, we have to ensure that our path comparisons
are case insensitive.

Change-Id: I4cb059c6bdcb09f7e0c3217fe34654c8e197b67d
Closes-Bug: #1878579

subject: fix comment grammar
messages:
[{'account_id': 31446, 'date': '2020-05-19 03:05:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24872, 'date': '2020-05-19 03:50:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hi fuzihao, Thanks for your patch and your interest in cyborg-tempest-plugin! But to be a reminder, please don't just submit a typo as one patch, if we do that, we will get too much typo patches in, which will distract us from those real important goals. So that's not recommended. If you want to contribute in tempest, your are very welcomed! And we have work to do for Victorial release,you can check topic 6 [Functional Testing]Add Tempest cases for more operations in https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/cyborg-victoria-goals. If you are new to openstack(no offense, just because I don't know your background), we also have low hanging fruits for beginner such as start from docs for cyborg-tempest-plugin. If you have any questions, I am happy to help!"}, {'account_id': 24872, 'date': '2020-05-19 03:56:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

And yes, if we have time, typos are definitely should be fixed.
I would recommend that you fix a bunch of typos in one patch together, that would be much better. That doesn't have to be 100% coverage, but please do as much as you can.
Thanks a lot!"}, {'account_id': 31446, 'date': '2020-05-19 05:35:55.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

resub'}]

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.0 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering

Update Sphinx version as well.

Create doc/requirements.txt file and use it, remove docs requirements
from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Set openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' as name.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/728938
Change-Id: Ic3503a8b38e67e50669428b36f6581cb980d687f

This change updates the Elasticsearch chart for compatibility with
the latest version of the Elasticsearch exporter. There are some
breaking changes between v1.0.1 and v1.1.0 - mainly with how arguments

commit_message:
Elasticsearch: Bump Exporter to v1.1.0 (latest/stable tag)

This change updates the Elasticsearch chart for compatibility with
the latest version of the Elasticsearch exporter. There are some
breaking changes between v1.0.1 and v1.1.0 - mainly with how arguments
are handled by the program.

All of the configuration options currently available are now exposed
in values.yaml

Change-Id: I8c71d5f6ed4a8360ad886338adb8ad63471eefd1

commit_message:
update ussuri container namespace to 'u'

The namespace 'tripleoussuri'
in docker.io has been taken by another
user in docker.io. Support contacted etc.

Use 'tripleou' instead of 'tripleoussuri'

Change-Id: I5a6851154c4e7b95e730eb261dd0b13b28fe52f8

undercloud reboot.

commit_message:
Fix remove nova-cert during FFU

The change to remove nova-cert service added in [1], but
it fails while trying to disable the service.

This change removes code block where we are disabling
the service.

Also confirmed that the service doesn't show up after
undercloud reboot.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/690930/

Closes-Bug: #1878743
Change-Id: I9c5772345088717d21d86ddc12c881ce69058180

'}, {'created': '2020-05-15 21:24:06.000000000', 'message': "Make quotas respect instance_list_per_project_cells

This option was introduced in order to limit queries to cells which only
belong to the project we're interacting with.  However, The nova quota
code was not respecting it and therefore it was always trying to get the
cells assigned to a project even with that option disabled.

This patch makes the quota code respect that option and adds testing to

commit_message:
Make quotas respect instance_list_per_project_cells

This option was introduced in order to limit queries to cells which only
belong to the project we're interacting with.  However, The nova quota
code was not respecting it and therefore it was always trying to get the
cells assigned to a project even with that option disabled.

This patch makes the quota code respect that option and adds testing to
ensure that enabling the option does make sure it doesn't search all
cells but only the ones for this project.

Closes-Bug: #1878979
Change-Id: I2e0d48e799e70d550f912ad8a424c86df3ade3a2

[{'account_id': 31470, 'date': '2020-01-03 11:31:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2020-01-03 11:31:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 28801, 'date': '2020-01-03 11:33:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-03 11:31:21.000000000', 'message': "Wrap each call to modify a volume within it's own try statement

When migrating/retyping a volume to a 3PAR from a different vendor
the process fails as the driver presumes the original volume is on
the 3PAR, therefore 404-ing during the first name change. By wrapping
each modifyVolume call in it's own try statement, more verbose error
logging is possible, and a missing original volume does not cause the
whole process to fail.

Update unit test to reflect the change of order in which the volumes
are renamed.

Closes-Bug: 1858119

Change-Id: I81e372804a6d5483b4f4207d5ba073274b754900
"}, {'created': '2020-01-03 15:03:17.000000000', 'message': "Wrap each call to modify a volume within it's own try statement

Update unit test to reflect the change of order in which the volumes
are renamed.

Closes-Bug: 1858119

Change-Id: I81e372804a6d5483b4f4207d5ba073274b754900
"}, {'created': '2020-01-08 11:52:48.000000000', 'message': 'Remove surplus calls to modifyVolume

When migrating/retyping a volume to a 3PAR from a different vendor
the process fails as the driver presumes the original volume is on
the 3PAR, therefore 404-ing during the first name change.

Most other dirvers just attempt to modify the volume without
touching the original, this change mirrors that behaviour.

Closes-Bug: 1858119

Change-Id: I81e372804a6d5483b4f4207d5ba073274b754900
'}]
commit_message:
Remove surplus calls to modifyVolume

When migrating/retyping a volume to a 3PAR from a different vendor
the process fails as the driver presumes the original volume is on
the 3PAR, therefore 404-ing during the first name change.

Most other dirvers just attempt to modify the volume without
touching the original, this change mirrors that behaviour.

Update unit test to reflect the change in the calls.

Closes-Bug: 1858119

Change-Id: I81e372804a6d5483b4f4207d5ba073274b754900

subject: Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-13 00:24:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: Ib119207db682d20c01be673c5bc91227c80709e1
'}]
commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: Ib119207db682d20c01be673c5bc91227c80709e1

[{'created': '2020-04-29 18:27:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ironic inspector rule creation idempotency

Ironic inspector rules are registered both with the seed and (if using)
overcloud ironic inspector services. These tasks often show up as
changed even when no configuration changes have been made that would
affect the rules.

This is caused by inspector returning default values for fields that may
be omitted in the requested rule. This change fixes the issue by
including those defaults in the comparison.

commit_message:
Fix ironic inspector rule creation idempotency

Ironic inspector rules are registered both with the seed and (if using)
overcloud ironic inspector services. These tasks often show up as
changed even when no configuration changes have been made that would
affect the rules.

This is caused by inspector returning default values for fields that may
be omitted in the requested rule. This change fixes the issue by
including those defaults in the comparison.

Change-Id: Ia24e328d4531201d76a65b6385e4463bb1f3c5c6
Story: 2007399
Task: 38997
(cherry picked from commit 2a00b4cc67df91c5eac10f4762aff543d3740e05)

hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to avoid bringing in a new
version with new checks.

bumping the min version for hacking so that any older hacking versions
which auto adopt the new checks are not used.

Change-Id: I94ae0a77aa8c96b842e62822c54c326192d75b55
'}, {'created': '2020-05-18 01:35:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I94ae0a77aa8c96b842e62822c54c326192d75b55
'}]
commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I94ae0a77aa8c96b842e62822c54c326192d75b55

commit_message:
Neutron ML2/OVS: add support to enable of IGMP snooping

Neutron ML2/OVS backend allows now to enable support for IGMP
snooping in the br-int bridge. This can be done through
"igmp_snooping_enable" config option which can be set for
neutron-ovs-agent.
Patch [1] added support for it in puppet-neutron module.
In patch [2] support to enable this option for ML2/OVN backend
was added but we missed same change for ML2/OVS. Now we will
have it too.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/707367/
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714462/

Conflicts:
    deployment/neutron/neutron-ovs-agent-container-puppet.yaml

Change-Id: I195410768d2d6a219bdda88a74fed3c29e1113a9
(cherry picked from commit 04c20f118a44e0385e64561e54c30fc2a8615c49)

is specific to docker, a platform we no longer support (replaced by
podman).

Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>

subject: Bump compatibility versions
messages:
[{'account_id': 26721, 'date': '2020-05-14 04:02:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26721, 'date': '2020-05-14 04:02:54.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from ups/master to deps'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-05-14 08:45:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

We have not tested with that concat version, we are pinned to 2.2.1 [1]. If we should bump this we first need to ensure our testing (and everything works) with later concat versions.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/blob/master/external_modules.txt#L8'}, {'account_id': 26721, 'date': '2020-05-14 10:20:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> We have not tested with that concat version, we are pinned to 2.2.1
 > [1]. If we should bump this we first need to ensure our testing
 > (and everything works) with later concat versions.
 > 
 > [1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/blob/master/external_modules.txt#L8

I understand your test does not include other versions. 

 > We have not tested with that concat version, we are pinned to 2.2.1
 > [1]. If we should bump this we first need to ensure our testing
 > (and everything works) with later concat versions.
 > 
 > [1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/blob/master/external_modules.txt#L8

Thanks, so I need to submit a patch for the version bump in puppet-openstack-integration, right?  The reason I submit this is because I found some versions are quite old and the dependencies are actually broken. One example is swift requires stdlib: ">=5.0.0 <7.0.0" but latest rsync which is required by swift requires stdlib:  ">=4.2.0 <5.0.0"'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-05-14 17:42:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

This is fine according to testing in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/728068/'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-05-14 17:43:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yea, I've wanted to fix up a job that installs with modules from PuppetForge just to validate the dependency setup in metadata and then only use the actual module that was changed in jobs but haven't had time to look at that."}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2020-05-18 22:58:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Normalize how we pull the users home folders

This change normalizes the way we pull the users home folders by ensuring we
respect the SUDO_USER environment variable.

Story: 2007458
Task: 39134

Change-Id: I41792e3a9463fe93ba219af6e397c96119fde5c1
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[ingress] Support nginx-ingress-controller 0.30.0

In 0.30.0 (busybox inside) the "find" tool doesn't support
"writable" option, so use "perm" instead. Also get rid of
several system calls by means of make all by one command.

Change-Id: Ia4f7bc01fb61f4f32c21c50d8c4e870d0244c868

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-12 20:16:29.000000000', 'message': 'Move inventory filters to tripleo-upgrade

The inventory filters for tripleo-upgrade were originally merged to
tripleo-ansible to promote re-use however we want to avoid adding this
as a dependency for tripleo-upgrade as it is not necessarily running on
the undercloud where we can assume tripleo-ansible is installed.
The use case for these filters is quite obscure and specific to the
tripleo-upgade playbooks (manually parsing the inventory yaml in an
ansible task) so the easiest option is to move them to tripleo-upgrade.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/727426
Change-Id: I8d7440af098c6dab12773e5a99f01e5ecb8a6b95
'}]
commit_message:
Move inventory filters to tripleo-upgrade

The inventory filters for tripleo-upgrade were originally merged to
tripleo-ansible to promote re-use however we want to avoid adding this
as a dependency for tripleo-upgrade as it is not necessarily running on
the undercloud where we can assume tripleo-ansible is installed.
The use case for these filters is quite obscure and specific to the
tripleo-upgade playbooks (manually parsing the inventory yaml in an
ansible task) so the easiest option is to move them to tripleo-upgrade.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/727426
Change-Id: I8d7440af098c6dab12773e5a99f01e5ecb8a6b95

commit_message:
Add yamllint check to lint job

Initial commit with bootstrapping non-voting configuration
for yamllint. Yamllint checks will be switched from 'warning'
to 'enabled' in subsequent commits together with code adjustments.

Also quotes %%%.* fields in netpol.yaml to make them valid.

Change-Id: I24cb0b7680f1fb9c0dfd98527e85440a6635d1d7

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-05-18 20:34:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2020-05-18 21:38:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-18 20:34:37.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.0 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Set openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' as name.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/728938
Change-Id: I31eada6a7e2628c16441adf54f3c2b97b9375103
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.0 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Set openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' as name.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/728938
Change-Id: I31eada6a7e2628c16441adf54f3c2b97b9375103

commit_message:
[devstack][ci] Fix floatingip allocation

A fix was committed [1] to the python-openstackclient
project to handle VMs with multiple ports. We can
drop the workaround of setting a floating IP to the
VM's port.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/commit/013c9a4f3a44cb0b81fc7affe9b933e701cb5dba

Change-Id: I67c38b4e6695c05a8272a86448ed248b492a279d
Closes-Bug: #1747721
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: Ic84db0e885c6560120548ecb2ebc16dde1cd23d1

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-15 19:14:06.000000000', 'message': 'Only notify nova of port status changes if configured

Although notify_nova_on_port_status_changes defaults to true, it
could be to false, making the nova_notifier attribute unsafe to
use without checking.

This patch checks both the config option and that the attribute
exists, since the config could be changed after the plugin is
already initialized without the nova_notifier attribute being set.

Change-Id: Ide0f93275e60dffda10b7da59f6d81c5582c3849
Closes-bug: #1843269
(cherry picked from commit ab4320edb4661f74465ec49166f8d35b8216035f)
'}]
commit_message:
Only notify nova of port status changes if configured

Although notify_nova_on_port_status_changes defaults to true, it
could be to false, making the nova_notifier attribute unsafe to
use without checking.

This patch checks both the config option and that the attribute
exists, since the config could be changed after the plugin is
already initialized without the nova_notifier attribute being set.

Change-Id: Ide0f93275e60dffda10b7da59f6d81c5582c3849
Closes-bug: #1843269
(cherry picked from commit ab4320edb4661f74465ec49166f8d35b8216035f)

commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: Ibe524fb12fe41de8a825e7b06647afb6c463deba
(cherry picked from commit 96ef4f5cf197fff0c9ce295797ed6471a60cf9a4)

commit_message:
Add common_deploy_steps to post_upgrade_steps.

When refactoring deploy-steps to add a common playbook [0] it seems that
the post_upgrade_steps_playbook block was missed. As a consequence, when
executing the post_upgrade_tasks some of the common Ansible variables
are not available.

[0] - Ib00e8aa9f7d06517290543a8aaf8a2527969bd3c

Change-Id: I04704a14a8b932e21d21348e10014c707a87eeeb
Closes-Bug: #1875579

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-14 20:29:51.000000000', 'message': 'Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: If5f2f970a353189f3eaeea00322848cb8346245c
'}, {'created': '2020-05-15 16:10:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

Also removing the hacking and other related dep from lower-constraints file
as theose are blacklisted requirements and does not need to be present
there.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: If5f2f970a353189f3eaeea00322848cb8346245c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

Also removing the hacking and other related dep from lower-constraints file
as theose are blacklisted requirements and does not need to be present
there.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: If5f2f970a353189f3eaeea00322848cb8346245c

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-15 17:07:02.000000000', 'message': 'Replace with_together with loop

We don't combine several arrays. This patch replaces with_together with
loop as we iterate over one list. Also, it adds "|default([])" to
compute as well as "non controllers and non computes" as there are cases
when deployment is done without computes and without ceph nodes.

Change-Id: Ia7b4c585152d3a78207829e0c43dabf562e5e91c
'}, {'created': '2020-05-15 22:42:30.000000000', 'message': 'Cater to non-composable environments

In a non-composable environment, the existing combinations may result
in an empty host list which currently does not work - it results in an
undefined error.

In this we ensure that the lists produced cater to an empty pacemaker
group so that HA, composable and non-HA environments are OK.

Change-Id: Ia7b4c585152d3a78207829e0c43dabf562e5e91c
'}]
commit_message:
Cater to non-composable environments

In a non-composable environment, the existing combinations may result
in an empty host list which currently does not work - it results in an
undefined error.

In this we ensure that the lists produced cater to an empty pacemaker
group so that HA, composable and non-HA environments are OK.

Change-Id: Ia7b4c585152d3a78207829e0c43dabf562e5e91c

commit_message:
Add print statemetns for log output

This change forces log entries to be printed to stdout for our deprecated
parameter checks. This is being done because the log handler we were
useing does not logging to a file or stdout by default. To ensure we're
not missing messages, all logged messages will be printed.

Change-Id: I638e55f894a213569d292289fc27242c5f0bdec1
Closes-Bug: #1866674
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add additional strategy optimization

This change adds a strategy optimization which will queue tasks only when required.
By doing this forward lookup we can omit entrire tasks, includes, and blocks when
pre-conditions are not met which will speed up task execution. While non-required
tasks should already be pruned, this will ensure that should if anything that slips
through it is handled.

Change-Id: Ie0bdb318294fbfc5ce885e795b3d52801cb89f36
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add missing README.rst in elements

Currently dib-lint ensures all elements have README.rst[1], and this
casuses failure in pep8 job because some elements doesn't have
README.rst.
This patch adds missing README.rst to fix pep8 failures to unblock
gate.

[1] Ia5252ddd89b5ae5c6e9a12a66ef10f912fd54da5

Change-Id: I0602de2323aedd5d3334d9a06fe23a3ef5daf4b7
(cherry picked from commit 632ea261a2f91993d688b745cd7d2fe54ab98d81)

commit_message:
Fix return results on cmd failure and error msgs

Return an empty list if container_names fails since that result is used
in a loop for many places.

Add error messages for better observability as well.

Change-Id: Ia79cbf74faa4d8190d2280757403fd2e5b67fbe0
Co-authored-by: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit a838a69c4f78686c3f471c79b766c427b5f2a6e8)

commit_message:
Add InternalTLSCAFile param when enabling overcloud ssl

This is used by the services and without setting this
paramter it would pick up the template default which
does not work.

Related-Bug :#1878540

messages: [{'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-05-18 18:50:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2020-05-18 18:51:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-18 18:50:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I064a585db868c6a4d19c4a88b686a63c81c8acaf
(cherry picked from commit 5b1465bd890ab4b3a66842f0bf44ab4888237f3d)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I064a585db868c6a4d19c4a88b686a63c81c8acaf
(cherry picked from commit 5b1465bd890ab4b3a66842f0bf44ab4888237f3d)

commit_message:
compute: Remove snapshot quiesce tests for STOPPED and SUSPENDED instances

At present only the libvirt virt driver implements any form of instance
quiescing and this is only done when the instance is ACTIVE. As a result
we can remove these two tests for STOPPED and SUSPENDED instances.

Change-Id: Ie9db52c31bfe5df70456342c3ec7f83c0e23487f

commit_message:
compute: Allow snapshots to be created from PAUSED volume backed instances

Iabeb44f843c3c04f767c4103038fcf6c52966ff3 allowed snapshots to be
created from PAUSED non-volume backed instances but missed the volume
backed use case.

This change simply adds PAUSED to the list of acceptable vm_states when
creating a snapshot from a volume backed instance in addition to the
already supported ACTIVE, STOPPED and SUSPENDED vm_states.

Closes-Bug: #1878583
Change-Id: I9f95a054de9d43ecaa50ff7ffc9343490e212d53

commit_message:
downgrade protobuf to version available on all architectures

Ibab788d0b31e2e1da145f20710233419b982b4c2 change moved it to 3.12.0
which is not installable on non-x86 architectures.

https://github.com/protocolbuffers/protobuf/issues/7520

Change-Id: Ib64cb6f3c2f83f506eb34649a51b7d4082dac3d9

subject: Add fonts-freefont-otf to pdf docs build prereqs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4690, 'name': 'melanie witt', 'display_name': 'melwitt', 'email': 'melwittt@gmail.com', 'username': 'melwitt'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2020-05-15 02:18:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2020-05-15 02:23:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This likely won't apply to all projects because it's needed only for those generating pdf docs with unicode chars somewhere in them. Feel free to -1 if this is not considered universally useful enough."}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2020-05-15 06:27:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Given that nova PDF generation seems to be failing without this, I think it is a useful addition.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2020-05-15 06:43:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This isn't the immediate reason the nova docs job is failing, sorry for causing confusion. This came up while I was chatting with clarkb today and I wanted to propose it before I forgot.

Nova docs job fails first because of openstackdocstheme >= 2.1.0 because it's no longer setting latex_engine = 'xelatex' that we need bc we have unicode chars in our docs. Then, after that, we get get farther in the build but then need the fonts.

Before the upper-constraints bump to openstackdocstheme > 2.0.2, we were passing our pdf generation _without_ adding the fonts and I don't have an explanation why, unfortunately.

In the immediate term, the upper-constraints have been rolled back to openstackdocstheme == 2.0.2:

https://review.opendev.org/728335

so the nova docs job should be OK, for now."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2020-05-15 07:09:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Gonna mark this -W for now while the openstackdocstheme stuff gets wrangled'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-05-15 07:10:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Melanie, we can merge this anytime, this is safe - no need to wait. Feel free to remove the WIP.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-05-15 15:27:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review -Workflow

This looks good but we don't know whether it's really needed, let's test whether  https://review.opendev.org/728263 needs it."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2020-05-18 19:08:49.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Seems to not be needed, so abandon for now.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-15 02:18:06.000000000', 'message': "Add fonts-freefont-otf to pdf docs build prereqs

When using a Unicode-based latex_engine like 'xelatex' or 'lualatex',
we need to use an OpenType font with wide-enough glyph coverage [1].

fonts-freefont-otf is a set of free high-quality OpenType fonts
covering the UCS character set.

[1] https://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/master/usage/configuration.html#confval-latex_engine
[2] https://packages.ubuntu.com/bionic/fonts-freefont-otf

Change-Id: I4b6c65cc8abc24c28b5558aeeef9d711ca3d307c
"}]
commit_message:
Add fonts-freefont-otf to pdf docs build prereqs

When using a Unicode-based latex_engine like 'xelatex' or 'lualatex',
we need to use an OpenType font with wide-enough glyph coverage [1].

fonts-freefont-otf is a set of free high-quality OpenType fonts
covering the UCS character set.

[1] https://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/master/usage/configuration.html#confval-latex_engine
[2] https://packages.ubuntu.com/bionic/fonts-freefont-otf

Change-Id: I4b6c65cc8abc24c28b5558aeeef9d711ca3d307c

compute any more. In the past the scheduler instance info is only

commit_message:
Update scheduler instance info at confirm resize

When a resize is confirmed the instance does not belong to the source
compute any more. In the past the scheduler instance info is only
updated by the _sync_scheduler_instance_info periodic. This caused that
server boots with anti-affinity did not consider the source host.
But now at the end of the confirm_resize call the compute also updates
the scheduler about the move.

Change-Id: Ic50e72e289b56ac54720ad0b719ceeb32487b8c8
Closes-Bug: #1869050
(cherry picked from commit 738110db7492b1360f5f197e8ecafd69a3b141b4)

[{'created': '2020-05-13 02:32:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I064a585db868c6a4d19c4a88b686a63c81c8acaf

commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: If20c898537b5ae4094715709e162928f0af95db6

commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

scheduler instance info prevents booting server with anti-affinity.

commit_message:
Bump hacking min version to 3.0.1

hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to avoid bringing in a new
version with new checks.

bumping the min version for hacking so that any older hacking versions
which auto adopt the new checks are not used.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/728335/

Change-Id: Ie00c10332bd7110169dbb150d601c157b6694d05
(cherry picked from commit 9f2e24a5a4787cd63d3651af7eec6bcf16b9fcce)
